creator: tobiasreif@pinkjuice.com
text:
[general, misc, and and pdf renderer]

Hi,

I'm using the latest DocBook XSLTs (1.53.0) and Saxon (6.5.2) to transform my
DocBook documents (4.2CR3) to FO, then I use FOP (0.20.4) to convert that to
PDF. The programlistings are garbled, and there are other issues; check

  http://www.pinkjuice.com/temp/fop/fop.txt
  http://www.pinkjuice.com/temp/fop/fop02.txt
  http://www.pinkjuice.com/temp/fop/programlisting_db.png
  http://www.pinkjuice.com/temp/fop/programlisting_pdf.png
It would be great if the unimplemented features would be available soon.
Especially output from the DBook XSLTs should be supported.

Tobi

creator: tobiasreif@pinkjuice.com
text:
... any update on the issues described?
Especially, I really need to get correct PDF output for the programlistsings in
the DocBook, and I would think that the FO generated for these is correct.
For me, I upgraded todocbook-xsl-1.55 and it now works for me.
creator: rimovm@centercomp.com
oleg@tkachenko.com
text:
Well, you need jimi library to work with png images, see
http://xml.apache.org/fop/relnotes.html. And for the other stuff new docbook-xsl
seems to a remedy.

creator: tobiasreif@pinkjuice.com
text:
I know; see the bottom of the one report I linked:
http://www.pinkjuice.com/temp/fop/fop.txt
I either made a mistake, or there was/is a problem with using it on Windows.

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
